title: Former pop star turned Essex councillor charms Conservative conference and teases he may stand as MP
text:
Former Guys 'n' Dolls star turned politician David Van Day teased that he could stand as a Member of Parliament while charming attendees at the Conservative Party conference.

Mr Van Day, formerly a member of the pop vocal duo Dollar, was elected as a local councillor in the Aveley and Upland ward on Thurrock Council, Essex in March, and attended the Tory conference in Manchester this week.

The 62-year-old entertainer, who starred I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! in 2008, praised Boris Johnson, backed Brexit and did not rule out standing as an MP himself.

'I'm very pro-Brexit,' he told the Daily Express. 'I like helping people, the Conservative Party has the values I share, and I wanted to engage with something real.'

David Van Day pictured with Conservative MP for Chelmsford Vicky Ford in March

When asked if he would consider standing, he said 'It's not out of the question.'

Mr Van Day, an admirer of Margaret Thatcher, said that he was not always as interested in politics, revealing that in his showbiz heyday he was 'just interested in partying, sex and drugs and rock 'n' roll'.

Speaking of Boris Johnson's love life, he said the Prime Minister had a 'naughty glance in his eye' - but praised his conference speech, saying there were a lot of jokes but he 'means business'.

Joking about what he would do if he were Prime Minister, Mr Van Day said he would ensure letterboxes are placed in the middle of the door, not at the bottom, because the lower ones cause 'back strain' while out canvassing.

He added that he would lower taxes and encourage entrepreneurs.

Mr Van Day had a fall from grace when he declared himself bankrupt and was reduced to selling fast food in Brighton, a career move which earned him the nickname Burger Van Day

After starting out as a vocalist in pop band Guys 'n' Dolls, Van Day, from South Ockendon, Essex, shot to fame as one half of the band Dollar (pictured: David Van Day and Thereza Bazar on 'Starburst' in 1982)

Mr Van Day was elected as a local councillor in the Aveley and Upland ward on Thurrock Council in March, taking the seat formerly held by independent Tim Aker.

He had previously unsuccessfully stood in local elections in Brighton in 2007.

After starting out as a vocalist in pop band Guys 'n' Dolls, Van Day, from South Ockendon, Essex, shot to fame as one half of the band Dollar.

During his heyday, Van Day threw himself into the high-octane celebrity life and reportedly blew £100,000 on cocaine.

But he had a spectacular fall from grace when he declared himself bankrupt in 2014 and was reduced to selling fast food in Brighton, a career move which earned him the nickname Burger Van Day.

He later re-invented himself from pop has-been to 'reality TV personality' - the highlight of which was a stint in the I'm A Celebrity jungle in 2008.

He claims to have slept with more than 1,000 women. For several years he was in a relationship with the other half of Dollar, Thereza Bazar.
description: David Van Day (pictured with MP Vicky Ford), has reinvented himself as a councillor in Thurrock, Essex. While at the Conservative Party conference, he did not rule out standing as an MP.
